results.title: The Trouble with Archie
results.brief_description: A dramatisation about a supervisor who learns to handle an employee who is always getting into trouble showing that the supervisor is firm and that at the same time he gives the employee a sense of responsibility.

results.title: The Troop grows
results.creator_credit: Boy Scouts of America. Visual Education Service
results.brief_description: This film is not intended for public promotional purposes, but is aimed at the Scoutmaster, in the belief that he is the key to a successful recruiting program. The film serves as an introduction, telling the story of how one scoutmaster solved his particular problems, discovering that they were tied up together with good program and boy leadership.

results.title: The Trojan women
results.brief_description: A joint Greek and American production based on Euripedes’ play “The Trojan women”. Katharine Hepburn is Hecube, the wife of King Priam; Vanessa Redgrave is Andromache, the widow of Hector; Genevieve Bujold is Cassandra, the cursed prophetess of Apollo and Trojan Princess and Irene Papas is the beautiful Helen of Troy. The victors of the Trojan war ransack the city and take as part of their spoils, the women and children. The play tells of their bitter struggle to survive the cruelty of defeat and capture.

results.title: The Trip (K)
results.creator_credit: Weston Woods Studios and Morton Schindel
results.brief_description: Louie is lonely when he moves out of his neighbourhood - so he constructs an imaginary world in a shoe box and flies off in his toy plane to visit old friends. The adventure helps Louie discover that friends are friends wherever you are. Based on the book by Ezra Jack Keats. Narrated by Charles Turner.

results.title: The Trip
results.brief_description: It’s Halloween and Louie is sad because his family has moved to a new neighbourhood and he doesn’t know anyone there. Left to play alone, Louise paints a scene in a shoebox and imagines himself back in his old street with his old friends, having wonderful adventures. Based on the book by Ezra Jack Keats and narrated by Charles Turner.

results.title: The Trials of life: a natural history of behaviour. - Part 2.
results.brief_description: Six half hour episodes on animal behaviour addressing survival, reproduction and communication. 1. “Finding the way” on sense of direction in animals, especially migratory birds. 2. “Fighting” 3. “Friends & rivals” on animals living co-operatively in communities, particularly lions and baboons. 4. “Talking to strangers” - communication between species, including animal to human. 5. “Courting” 6. “Continuing the line” Narrated by renowned British naturalist, David Attenborough.
results.title_for_label: The Trials of life: a natural history of behaviour. - Part 2.
results.description: Six half hour episodes on animal behaviour addressing survival, reproduction and communication. 1. “Finding the way” on sense of direction in animals, especially migratory birds. 2. “Fighting” 3. “Friends & rivals” on animals living co-operatively in communities, particularly lions and baboons. 4. “Talking to strangers” - communication between species, including animal to human. 5. “Courting” 6. “Continuing the line” Narrated by renowned British naturalist, David Attenborough.

results.title: The trials of life: a natural history of behaviour. - Part 1.
results.creator_credit: BBC, ABC-TV (Australia), Turner Broadcasting System and Peter Jones
results.brief_description: Six half-hour episodes of David Attenborough’s series on animal behaviour, examining why creatures behave as they do and showing that their lives are a series of problems to be faced and overcome. The episodes are - 1. Arriving (on reproduction and birth) 2. Growing up (on parental protection) 3. Finding food (the interdependence of plants and animals) 4. Hunting & escaping (Attack and defence behaviour) 5. Living together (Companion species) 6. Home making (Burrows, nests etc. for safety).

results.creator_credit_for_label: BBC, ABC-TV (Australia), Turner Broadcasting System and Peter Jones

results.title: The Trials of Franz Kafka
results.creator_credit: Kratky Film, Harold Mantell Inc and Harold Mantell
results.brief_description: An interpretation of the trials of childhood, youth, and tragic adulthood which Kafka described in his novels and stories, photographed in the author’s native Prague. Displays an understanding of modern man’s anxiety and alienation. English version adapted by Harold Mantell Inc. Narrated by Kurt Vonnegut Jr.
